Body: Julia played tag with 9 kids on monday, 7 kids on tuesday and 96 kids on wednesday.
Question: How many more kids did she play with on monday than on tuesday?

Body: In a school there are 402 more girls than boys. If there are 739 girls
Question: How many boys are there in that school?

Body: For Gwen's birthday she received 2 dollars from her mom. Her dad gave her 4 more dollars. If she spent 3 dollars.
Question: How much money did she still have?

Body: 6 red peaches, 90 yellow peaches and 16 green peaches are in the basket.
Question: How many red and green peaches are in the basket?

Body: Randy has 37 blocks. He uses 33 blocks to build a tower and 13 blocks to build a house.
Question: How many more blocks did he use to build the tower than he did to build the house?

Body: The Razorback shop makes $ 76 dollars off each jersey and $ 204 off each t-shirt. During the Arkansas and Texas tech game they sold 158 t-shirts and 2 jerseys.
Question: How much money did they make from selling the jerseys?

Body: Baker made 8 cakes. He bought 139 new cakes and sold 145 cakes.
Question: How many more cakes did baker sell than those he bought?

Body: Jack received 6 emails and 8 letters in the morning. He then received 2 emails and 7 letters in the afternoon.
Question: How many more letters did Jack receive in the morning than in the afternoon?

Body: Jake has 3 fewer peaches and 10 more apples than Steven. Steven has 12 peaches and 15 apples.
Question: How many more apples than peaches does Steven have?

Body: Rachel had to complete 5 pages of math homework and 2 pages of reading homework.
Question: How many more pages of math homework than reading homework did she have?
